name: Hardest 52: DC's Missing Year Trivia Quiz | Comics | 15 Questions

questions.text: Which new superhero appears in Metropolis?
questions.explanation:
Supernova.

	Possessing Superman-like powers, some people thought that Supernova was Superman in disguise. Booster Gold became jealous of the new hero, but it was revealed that they were the same person, using time technology to appear in the same place at once.

questions.text: Which hero was found by Detective Chimp?
questions.explanation:
Ralph Dibny.

	Mourning the death of his wife, Ralph seemingly found the helmet of Fate, and went on a dimension-spanning journey to learn about magic. Dibny deduced that Fate was really the evil Felix Faust, and gave his life to trap Faust and the demon Neron in a solitary tower.

questions.text: Which hero fought Lex Luthor and brought him to justice?
questions.explanation:
Steel.

	Lex Luthor began the Everyman Project, giving superpowers to normal people. Seen as renegades without a moral code by the rest of the superhero community, most of the people lost their powers.

questions.text: Which hero did not venture into space?
questions.explanation:
The Question.

	The Question spent much of the year in Nanda Parbat, Gotham City and Kahndaq, trying to stop Intergang. Animal Man, Adam Strange and Starfire all went into space, meeting up with Lobo.

questions.text: Harvey Bullock became the new Question.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Detective Renee Montoya became the new Question after Charles Szasz succumbed to lung cancer. She underwent martial arts training by Richard Dragon in Nanda Parbat.

questions.text: Who gave some of his power to a crippled boy?
questions.explanation:
Black Adam.

	While Captain Marvel did give his power to a crippled boy, he didn't do it during the series. That distinction belongs to Black Adam, who gave a young man the power to become the superpowered Osiris.

questions.text: Who always complained of being hungry?
questions.explanation:
Sobek.

	Sobek was a genetically-engineered crocodile who accompanied the Black Marvel family on many of their adventures. He eventually came out as Hunger, one of the four Horsemen of Apokolips.

questions.text: Who helped Black Adam defeat the Four Horsemen of Apokolips?
questions.explanation:
Isis.

	Isis was a slave before Black Adam granted her superpowers. The two were married and lived happily until she was killed fighting the Four Horsemen. In a rage, Black Adam destroyed an entire nation that was hiding the last Horseman.

questions.text: Who became a new official of Checkmate?
questions.explanation:
Alan Scott.

	Alan Scott was the original Green Lantern, deriving his power from a different source than the Oa power batteries. He has served on the Justice Society of America for years.

questions.text: Who travels to Rip Hunter's bunker?
questions.explanation:
Booster Gold.

	While there, Booster finds many enigmatic questions scrawled on a plethora of chalkboards. Hunter and Gold later team up to devise Supernova.

questions.text: Who traps Booster Gold's ancestor in a time loop?
questions.explanation:
Skeets.

	Skeets is Booster Gold's robotic assistant, who was revealed to be more villainous than previously thought. He went to find Booster after his apparent death.

questions.text: Who joins a cult during the lost year?
questions.explanation:
Cassandra Sandsmark.

	Cassandra Sandsmark's boyfriend and lover, Conner Kent, was killed during Infinite Crisis. Grief-stricken, she joins a cult that hopes to resurrect him.

questions.text: Who is not on the island of mad scientists?
questions.explanation:
Tot Rodor.

	The mad scientists are gathered by Intergang to develop new weapons, and they build the Four Horsemen of Apokolips. All four are killed by Black Adam and Isis, but Black Adam is captured by the scientists.

questions.text: Who counted the steps to Nanda Parbat?
questions.explanation:
Tim Drake and Renee Montoya.

	Tim and Renee are both at Nanda Parbat, Tim to wait for Bruce Wayne and Renee to hone her martial arts skills. There are 9,999 steps to Nanda Parbat.

questions.text: Where is the Red Tornado rebuilt?
questions.explanation:
Australia.

	The Red Tornado is a robot originally built by T. O. Morrow, but becoming a superhero and rebelling against his creator. A new robot was rebuilt in Australia, but it was vastly inferior to other models.
